entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 3:20AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LIGHT FREEZING RAIN POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... A weak front could bring light freezing rain and trace ice accumulations as it moves across the Kuskokwim Delta late today into Thursday. Precipitation chances will be around 30-50% during this time.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 21 at 1:32PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... The Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Alert which is IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM AKST WEDNESDAY. North Pole has a Stage 2 alert.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 22 at 10:26AM EST until further notice by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 12:57PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LIGHT WINTRY MIX POSSIBLE TONIGHT... Precipitation is expected to transition from light rain or drizzle this afternoon, to a mixture of rain, snow, and patchy freezing drizzle overnight. Should freezing drizzle develop, it will most likely be confined to the highest elevation, west facing ridges.

entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM AST THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to a northerly swell. * WHERE...Beaches across Mayaguez and Vicinity, particularly beaches in Rincon and Aguada, Culebra and St Thomas, St. John, and adjacent islands.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 2:50PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong wind gusts this afternoon... Expect gusty wind in the mountains and foothills of Virginia and North Carolina. VDOT sensors indicated wind gusts of 40 to 45 mph through Fancy Gap in Carroll County Virginia. Conditions will gradually improve this evening. Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 2:13PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Freezing Drizzle Possible Tonight in the Higher Terrain... Expect drizzle tonight across the higher terrain. The drizzle may transition to patchy freezing drizzle with the potential for a thin glaze of ice in the higher elevations as temperature falls to freezing or below. Slow down and use caution while traveling as slick spots could

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 1:18PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LIGHT WINTRY MIX POSSIBLE LATE TODAY INTO TONIGHT... A transition from light rain and drizzle to a wintry mix of rain, snow, and freezing drizzle is expected to occur along the higher ridges late today into tonight. Slow down and use caution while traveling as slick spots could form on roadways.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 12:57PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LIGHT WINTRY MIX POSSIBLE TONIGHT... Precipitation is expected to transition from light rain or drizzle this afternoon, to a mixture of rain, snow, and patchy freezing drizzle overnight. Should freezing drizzle develop, it will most likely be confined to the highest elevation, west facing ridges.
